column109: We are gonna have a great time.
column110: [garbage] I'm going to live on campus. I mean, well, around campus, anyway. Yeah, housing around campus.

column124: So when do you know, like, where you're gonna live? and-
column125: Well, I don't know. I've got to go look for a place.
column127: Yeah, yeah. I- I don't- I don't know. Do you have any suggestions?
column129: You know the area better than I do.
column130: Yeah. I mean, I know, I know, like the- the housing surrounding the campus pretty well.
column131: Um- How many people do you want to live with?
column132: Not a lot. I mean, I wouldn't want to live with more than three other people. So, like four of us total, right?
column134: I don't care. I don't care.
column135: Um- I think I have some friends.

column143: Cheap is exactly what I need- Because I have no money at all.

column147: You've got a lot- oh, awesome.
column149: So it comes Indian like. And you know I'm kind of smart, so.

column158: You're gonna be so busy, too. You're going to have to work so hard.
column160: But I'm so looking forward to being so busy. You know what I mean? It's the kind of busy you've got to love, right?
column161: Because you're doing something you love. That's the kind of busy you want. I want to be able to do that for the rest of my life. Be that kind of busy.
column163: I had to tell you right away. I knew you'd be excited.
column165: Yeah. We'll have so much fun.

column65: No, I figured the best thing was to leave him alone.

column84: You know it's not only my business.

column94: Now you can go on from there and you know where to go, but I'm telling you I don't know where to go. See I don't know. Now what can I do for you?
column95: I don't know why it is but every time I reach out for something I want, I have to pull back because other people will suffer. My whole bloody life time after time after time.
column96: You're a considerate fellow. There's nothing wrong in that.

column103: So what I'm not fast with women.

column119: Then you help me stay here.

column92: Hi,um- I think my baggage was lost, and I need to I guess file a claim or I don't know what.
column93: Okay, what flight were you on?
column96: It was Virgin Atlantic coming from London.
column97: From London, okay. Um- And you went through all your proper checkpoints?
column98: Yeah, I don't know where it was lost. I was coming from Africa, so.
column99: So you haven't seen your bags since Africa. You flew threw Heath Row to here.
column102: Okay. Well, let me see here. I-
column103: It seems like it went through Heath Row. I see it here. uh-
column105: But uh- I don't see it here in the airport yet. uh
column106: I'm not sure where it is. We can absolutely keep an eye out for for it for you.
column107: Well, I can't leave without it. I mean, Could you find out?
column108: Well, I'm not a miracle worker. I don't know what I can do for you. I don't have the bag right here.
column109: Right, well can you get on the computer maybe and like track it down and see when it's going to get here?
column110: Well, as I told you, it left Heath Row and it seems to have arrived here. But if you can't find it, then-are you sure you know what your bag looks like?
column111: Yes, sir, I know what my bag looks like.
column112: Okay, and what is that? What kind of bag is it?
column113: Um- It's a travel backpack. It's green and gray. It's got my name on it and my information.
column115: No, it didn't turn up at the baggage claim.
column117: I mean we've gone through all of this. I've been to five people already who--
column118: Well, obviously, that wasn't me, so I'm going to have to ask you the same questions they asked you just so we can get to the same point.
column120: All right? Now, um- it's green, travel bag, you couldn't find it. And was there something important in it that you need it?
column121: Yes, lots of really like -- sentimental value only, but--
column123: Right. Well, I don't know what to tell you. Um- What I can offer you is a fifty dollar voucher on your next flight.
column124: No, I understand. I mean. It's got to be tough all those sentimental things, but um- this is all I can do for you.
column125: Does this happen often? Do they--you just lose baggage and you just offer people money for it?
column126: Well, you know, sometimes that's--really, I mean what else could we do?
column127: Uh- Not lose the baggage in the first place. I mean You're offering a service here. I paid so much money for that ticket.
column131: Let's- Let's just relax for a moment, ma'am. You understand, obviously, we're going to do everything we can to keep all of your luggage here.
column132: Obviously, we're not trying to lose your luggage. Do you really believe that we're trying to lose your luggage ma'am?
column133: No, but I mean like why can't- why can't you find it? Where did it go? Who lost it?
column134: Well, I just-I paid so much money for this ticket. I feel like you guys should be able to get-to offer me more than a fifty dollar voucher.
column135: Well, we're talking about one bag. You personally made it here, didn't you?
column136: Yeah, meaning I didn't die in a fiery plane crash. How convenient, but um- I paid two thousand dollar to ride your airline, and I would really appreciate getting my bags there to my destination in one place.
column137: That's what the cost of the ticket was for.
column138: Ma'am, international flights are not cheap and there's many reasons for that. It does not have solely to do with your baggage or-
column139: Right, but part of the agreement is that I'm paying so that I can take myself and my belongings with me.
column141: And that you're going to transport them safely from one place to another.
column142: Right, and also if you'll read the fine print of your agreement you'll see that while we do bear some responsibility for lost luggage, it is a fifty dollar voucher.
column143: That's all you can offer me? I mean, my the stuff in there is worth way more than fifty dollar.
column144: Well, I understand that. Did you buy flight insurance?
column145: Well, my hands are really tied then.
column146: Why do I need flight insurance? Why don't you guys just guarantee that you're going to get the stuff that I leave with to my destination?
column147: Well, it's like any kind of insurance. You don't-when you get it, then you get more. You know, Like if you--
column148: Right, but if I'm riding a bus, I don't need to buy luggage insurance that the backpack I take on is going to get to my destination with me.
column149: Well, of course not because you've got your backpack with you the whole time. Now, if you--you said this was a travel bag. Why weren't you carrying it on if it was so important?
column150: Because they made me check it. It's too heavy.
column151: Uh, so it was really heavy.
column152: Well, you know what, it could still turn up, but until then I can offer you this fifty dollar voucher.
column153: There's nothing else you can do?
